title: Sex, Liberty and Licence in the Eighteenth Century
author: Peter Cryle, Lisa O’Connell
container_title: Libertine Enlightenment: Sex, Liberty and Licence in the Eighteenth Century
mla_citation: Cryle, Peter, and Lisa O’Connell. “Sex, Liberty and Licence in the Eighteenth Century.” Libertine Enlightenment: Sex, Liberty and Licence in the Eighteenth Century, edited by Peter Cryle and Lisa O’Connell, Palgrave Macmillan UK, 2003, pp. 1–14.
content_summary: This introductory essay surveys the major themes of libertinism in the eighteenth century, tracing its cultural, sexual, and political expressions. Harriette Wilson is briefly discussed among other figures, with a focus on how scandal, sexuality, and public exposure functioned within libertine discourse.
notes: Includes selected passages mentioning Harriette Wilson; used as contextual material.
